entry.title: What I cooked for dinner

entry.content:
A running list of what I am cooking for dinner. Use it for ideas or to entertain your boredom. This will be a long, ongoing list, so I'll keep it simple for you. Here's what to expect below:
  • What I cooked (don't worry there will be a photo)
  • What I experimented with
  • What I liked and disliked
  • Other thoughts. I'll try to spare you here. I'm a cutthroat critic of my own cooking

 

April 29, 2025

Swamp chickpea fusilli with sous vide chicken breast & toasted chili oil breadcrumbs

Such an odd meal to start with. I have never cooked this and rarely eat these items.

What I experimented with:

  • "Swamp sauce" - Blanched kale, parsley, serrano, garlic, lemon juice and zest, EVOO, S&P.
  • Flavored bread crumbs - not sure why I haven't been doing this
What I liked and disliked

  • ✅ Swamp sauce was tasty and nutritious. It needed to be thinned out by more pasta water than I expected. ❌ I left it a bit dry. 6/10
  • ✅ Flavored bread crumbs. Simple and makes everything crunchy. This dish was all soft otherwise
  • ❌ Sous vide chicken - about the only way to cook a boneless skinless (flavorless) chicken breast. I salted about 8 hours before dropping in the bath. Flavor was great, but slightly dry still. Not sure if I brined too long or what. Sous vide at 158 F for 1 hour, rested 10 min, then seared.
